pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:0.5: 72. The training rule on walking off the path
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were walking off the path while giving a teaching to people walking on the path. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:1.3: “‘I will not give a teaching while walking off the path to anyone walking on the path who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:1.4: One should not give a teaching while walking off the path to anyone walking on the path who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:1.5: If a monk out of disrespect gives a teaching while walking off the path to someone walking on the path who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:1.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:1.9: The twelfth training rule is finished.
